thread.title: APRA ponders bank capital increases

title: APRA ponders bank capital increases
text:
Mon, Jul 13, 2015, 9:44 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 16 mins. APRA ponders bank capital increases AAP – 6 minutes ago Print 
Australia's major banks would need to lift their capital reserves by a full two percentage points if regulators were to adopt a key recommendation of the government's inquiry into the financial system. 
The Financial System Inquiry last year recommended banks be required to hold enough capital reserves to rank in the top quartile of international lenders. 
A study released by the Australian Prudential Regulatory Authority shows banks would need to add at least 200 basis points worth of capital in order to meet that requirement, though the regulatory has yet to decide whether to adopt the measure. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Kathmandu boss sets sights on Asia AAP
